revision.text:
{{Infobox Election | election_name = San Marino general election, 1923 | country = San Marino | type = legislative | ongoing = no | previous_election = Sammarinese general election, 1920 | previous_year = 1920 | previous_mps = List of MPs elected in the Sammarinese general election, 1920 | turnout = '''35.2%''' | next_election = Sammarinese general election, 1926 | next_year = 1926 | next_mps = List of MPs elected in the Sammarinese general election, 1926 | elected_mps = [[List of MPs elected in the Sammarinese general election, 1923|Members elected]] | seats_for_election = All 60 seats to the [[Grand and General Council]] | election_date = 4 March 1923 | image1 = [[File:Black flag waving.svg|100x100px]] | party1 = Patriotic Bloc (San Marino)|Patriotic Bloc | last_election1 = 42 seats, 70.4% | seats1 = 60 | seat_change1 = {{increase}}18 | popular_vote1 = 1,437 | percentage1 = 100.0% | swing1 = {{increase}}29.6% | title = | posttitle = | before_election = | before_party = | after_election = | after_party = }} '''General elections''' were held in [[San Marino]] on 4 March 1923 to elect the '''seventh term''' of the [[Grand and General Council]].<ref name=NS>[[Dieter Nohlen|Nohlen, D]] & Stöver, P (2010) ''Elections in Europe: A data handbook'', p1678 ISBN 978-3-8329-5609-7</ref> It was a [[snap election]] which marked the beginning of the [[Fascist]] rule of the republic. [[Left-wing]] parties was prevented from participating, while all [[centre-right]] forces ran as a single "Patriotic Bloc".<ref>Nohlen & Stöver, p1686</ref> Of the 60 seats, 29 were taken by the [[Sammarinese Fascist Party]], 20 by the [[Sammarinese People's Party]], 9 by the [[Sammarinese Democratic Union]] and two by the Fascist-puppets ''[[Sammarinese Fascist Party|Volunteers of War]]''.<ref>Nohlen & Stöver, p1690</ref> Later the country was taken over by the Fascist Party.<ref>Nohlen & Stöver, p1670</ref>
==History== San Marino had been close to a civil war in 1921, with Socialist red forces by a hand, and Christian Democratic white forces on the opposite side together with the Conservatives. The situation was so explosive that the government introduced a six-month censorship,<ref>Law 13 adopted on May 13, 1921. [http://www.consigliograndeegenerale.sm/on-line/home/archivio-leggi-decreti-e-regolamenti.html?P0_path=%2Fhome%2Ftomcat%2Findicizzazione%2Findexleggi&P0_paginazione=15&P0_pagina=3&P0_orderBy=index_lucene%2Cdata_ordered%2Cnumero&P0_order=asc%2Cdesc%2Cdesc&P0_operatorMustBe=yes&P0_title=&P0_tipo=&P0_numero=&P0_anno=1921&annoiniziale=&annofinale=&P0_data_gg=&P0_data_mm=&P0_data_aa=&P0_document=&P0_data_ordered=&indicericerca=5.9884367&x=36&y=11&=& Grand and General Council database ] (it.)</ref> and called a [[carabinieri]] garrison to restore order, while [[Fascist]] brigades entered in the country without invitation. Meanwhile, Sammarinese authorities became closer to [[Italy]], as underlined by the adoption of the anniversary of Italian victory in [[World War I]] as [[public holiday]].<ref>Law 33 adopted on November 16, 1922. [http://www.consigliograndeegenerale.sm/on-line/home/archivio-leggi-decreti-e-regolamenti.html?P0_path=%2Fhome%2Ftomcat%2Findicizzazione%2Findexleggi&P0_paginazione=15&P0_pagina=1&P0_orderBy=index_lucene%2Cdata_ordered%2Cnumero&P0_order=asc%2Cdesc%2Cdesc&P0_operatorMustBe=yes&P0_title=&P0_tipo=&P0_numero=&P0_anno=1922&annoiniziale=&annofinale=&P0_data_gg=&P0_data_mm=&P0_data_aa=&P0_document=&P0_data_ordered=&indicericerca=6.2646894&x=32&y=6&=&=& Grand and General Council database ] (it.)</ref>
When [[Benito Mussolini]] rose to power at [[Rome]], he immediately menaged to take control over the small republic. The old Council was forcely disbanded on January 27, 1923, and a [[snap election]] was consequently called. Fascist threats obtained their goal: the Socialist Party did not take part to the election and a sole, centre-right list called ''Patriotic Bloc'' ran undisputed. The Bloc was obviously dominated by the [[Sammarinese Fascist Party]], which obtained the majority of seats together with their puppets ''Volunteers of War''. The turnout was very low, leftist electors boycotting the vote.
Twenty-nine years old [[Giuliano Gozi]] became the first Fascist [[Captain Regent]] in April 1923. The party political program was to dismantle all democratic reforms of the [[Sammarinese Citizenry Meeting, 1906|Meeting of 1906]], and to emulate the Italian regime. A Sammarinese carabinieri corps was created, the anniversary of the [[March on Rome]] became a public holiday, and the Captains of the [[Municipalities of San Marino|Castles of San Marino]] became appointed by the Captains Regents.
==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Party !Votes !% !Seats |- |align=left|[[Patriotic Bloc (San Marino)|Patriotic Bloc]]||1,437||100.0||60 |- |align=left|Invalid/blank votes||47||–||– |- |align=left|'''Total'''||'''1,484'''||'''100.0'''||'''60''' |- |align=left|Registered voters/turnout||4,184||35.2||– |- |align=left colspan=4|Source: Nohlen & Stöver |}
